title: two clubbers stunned to discover spooky ghoul photobombing selfie on night out
story: Full-time mum Nikki Furness-Winmill, , was enjoying some drinks with friend Vicki Webb, , in Blandford Forum, Dorset, earlier this month when the pair snapped a few selfies on the dance-floor of The Greyhound pub.But it wasn’t until the next morning when the spooked pals allegedly discovered the terrying outline of a ghostly male face appear to be leaning over their shoulders.The women first thought they had been photobombed by another reveller but soon realised the creepy face did not seem human.Neither can explain what the face in the picture was, and they claim it still remains a mystery.Mum-of-one Nikki said: We were on the dance floor when we took a few pictures with my phone.“The first thing I thought was that someone had photobombed us.But the more I looked at it, the more it didnt seem right.Her friend Vicki, a neighbourhood officer, from Norwich said: It was at the end of the night, when we got home that Nikki had sent me the photos from the evening and as I looked through them that particular one made me laugh, I thought someone had photobombed us.It was only when I showed Nikki in the morning that we realised how creepy and weird it looked.Nikki got in touch with Paranormal Investigations UK, where they ran some tests confirming the ghostly authenticity of the picture.She has since discovered The Greyhound was rebuilt in  after a huge fire which claimed lives - so she believes the building could be haunted.Nikki added: I have no idea what it might be. I do believe in ghosts, and it looks like it has the form of a person.“I know the pub was rebuilt after a big fire in , I can imagine a great number of people died in that fire.Vicki added: Ive never been a massive believer in the spiritual world so my initial reaction was that it was just someone photobombing us – but neither of us could remember anyone being that close to us on the dance floor.Perhaps we did have a friendly ghost partying with us that night  It did give me the Heebie Jeebies for a bit.I didnt want to look in my rear view mirror when driving in the dark for a few nights.

title: budget 2018 universal credit 630 benefits
story: The Chancellor revealed in his his Budget that he will put extra funding into the welfare system to help those struggling.Mr Hammond said today that he would increase the work allowances in Universal Credit by £, - allowing millions of people to earn £ more automatically from next April. . million households are set to benefit from the change.And he will pump £billion into the new system overall for the next five years to help those going onto the flagship programme get eased in. Other measures will cost him £.billion - including reducing debts for those on benefits, and giving them more upfront before switching over.The Sun has called for the Chancellor to plug the gap in the flagship benefits system, which emerged after George Osborne cut the work allowance back when he was in charge.But critics are saying this cash doesnt go far enough - think tanks said around £billion was needed to reverse all the gaps in the system.The small print said:While today’s reforms certainly won’t end all the problems some recipients have faced with Universal Credit, they should ease the rollout in the months and years ahead.But Lib Dem MP Stephen Lloyd said it wouldnt cover all the costs of the Osborne cuts., and there were still issues with the new system.He raged: UC’s serious design flaws were also not addressed, from long waiting times that are pushing people into indebtedness, to problems in how landlords are paid housing benefit.The pain caused by the roll-out of UC is not over yet.Today we revealed how a single mum is at risk of homelessness after going on to the new system - and isnt eligible for help with her mortgage debt payments.Tina Davidson says she feels tossed aside by the system and has had to put the house shes lived in for  years up for sale to pay off debts.The new system is designed to try and get more Brits into work and less reliant on the welfare system, but its been beset with problems.Many say its pushing them into debt as the wait for the first payment is at least five weeks.Others say they were driven to payday loans and even prostitution to try and make ends meet.Ministers say they are constantly trying to fix the systems problems as they go along - and the new system is much less complicated than the old one.It was reported earlier this month that ministers are planning moves to slow down the roll out to try and fix some of the issues.They can take out emergency loans, but have to start paying them back immediately so they get deducted from their benefits.Highlights of todays Budget include:

title: cnn suspicious package intercepted mail centre
story: A package addressed to the news networks headquarters in Atlanta was identied at a post office in the area.CNNs president Jeff Zucker issued a statement saying: This morning, another suspicious package addressed to CNN was intercepted at an Atlanta post office.There is no imminent danger to the CNN Centre.All mail at CNN domestic bureaus is being screened at off-site facilities as of last Wednesday so this package would NOT have come directly to the CNN Centre, evenit hadnt been intercepted first.Our screening process is working and we will keep you updated as we learn more.The package was intercepted three days after a man was arrested for sending a wave of parcel bombs to prominent Democrats, critics of U.S. President Donald Trump and CNN.Cesar Sayoc, , was arrested on Friday and is suspected of sending  explosive devices to critics of the President, including Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton and Robert De Niro.At this stage it is not knownthe package intercepted today is linked to those Sayoc is suspected of posting, but local reports indicate the package looked similar.Public records showed Sayoc has been arrested numerous times over the years for domestic violence, theft and other charges, according to Reuters.In one case, court records show he was convicted  on a charge of threatening to throw, place, project or discharge any destructive device.He is a promoter, booking agent and live entertainment owner, according to his LinkedIn profile, which used his middle name, Altieri, and listed him as the owner of International Gold Productions.Sayoc is charged with five felony counts.They are interstate transportation and illegal mailing of explosives, threatening a former president, making threatening interstate communications and assaulting federal officers.The case is expected to be moved to New York, where he will be prosecuted by the U.S. Attorneys Office of the Southern District of New York, officials said.FBI Director Christopher Wray also spoke to reporters warning the US public to stay vigilant as other packages may still be in transit or in mail facilities around the country.He added that the bombs were “not hoax devices” while revealing that Sayoc’s fingerprints were found on the package sent to Democratic congresswoman Maxine Waters.Investigators then found DNA on two other packages which matched a sample taken from the suspect in a prior arrest.Wray described the bombs as “IEDs”, meaning improvised explosive devices, while adding that at least  bombs were sent out across the United States.

title: chancellor philip hammond budget speech commons
story: The Chancellor revealed public spending is set to rise by an extra £billion while million Brits will get a tax cut, vowing: Britain is open for business.As well as £billion to be spent on the NHS, he promised additional money for defence, schools and local councils - which have all faced relentless cuts over nearly a decade.And he is pumping an extra £.billion a year into the troubled Universal Credit system in a bid to ensure that it pays to be in work for everyone.Speaking in the Commons, he said: I present a Budget for Britain’s future, a budget that shows the perseverance of the British people finally paying off.A Budget for hard working families... people who get up early in the morning to open up factories, shops, and building sites, to drop their kids off at school, to check on elderly relatives and neighbours.The strivers, the grafters and the carers who are the backbone of our communities and our economy.He defended the Tories record of austerity since , saying that spending cuts were driven by necessity and adding: We did what needed to be done.But praising the sacrices made by Brits, he concluded: Their hard work is paying off - the era of austerity is finally coming to an end.The Chancellor did not go as far as Theresa May - who told the Tory party conference this month, People need to know that austerity is over.Highlights of todays Budget include:The Chancellor announced that he is imposing a new tax on the revenues of large tech firms which operate in the UK.The UK digital services tax is set to raise at least £million a year from , Mr Hammond said, and will apply to all the British sales of global web giants - not just their profits, as is the case currently.He blasted: We are serious about this reform - profitable businesses need to pay their fare share to our pub services.In a jokey reference to Nick Cleggs new job as Facebooks top spin doctor, he added: I am already looking forward to my call from the former leader of the Liberal Democrats.Mr Hammond confirmed thatwe crash out of the EU without a deal, he will hold an emergency Budget next spring aimed at shoring up the economy.And he committed an extra £million to preparations for a possible No Deal scenario to ensure the Government is ready for any outcome.He said: This is a pivotal moment in our EU negotiations - the stakes could not be higher.If we get it right, we will harvest a double deal idend.Mr Hammond predicted that cutting a good deal with the EU would boost Britains economy as a whole, as well as freeing up the cash previously put aside to cope with a possible No Deal scenario.The Chancellor also revealed that the economy is growing faster than previously predicted while the deficit is set to fall to . per cent - down from nearly  per cent under Labour.He confirmed that borrowing this year has been £.billion lower than forecast, giving him the room to spend more without having to hike taxes.The Chancellor said that after eight years of cuts, public spending will start to grow from next year - increasing by at least . per cent annually.The spending increases he announced include more than £billion going into the NHS over five years, previously promised by the PM.Mocking his reputation of being a man who is financially responsible: Fiscal Phil says fiscal rules OK.On new business rate relief on public toilets: so that local authorities can at least relief themselves... its the only announcement in this Budget that hasnt leaked!On John McDonnells recent tumble, leaving him with scars on his face: I can’t guarantee to the House that £million is going to be enough to stop him falling flat on his face in the future.On his bad predictions about jobs: the Shadow Chancellor’s prediction of .million jobs lost out by the tiny margin of .million - or roughly the population of Scotland!He said: We made our big choice four months before the Budget was delivered - the NHS is our number one priority.The cash boost will see extra funding go towards mental health treatment in a bid to ensure people suffering from a crisis, young or old, can get the help the need.Mr Hammond also pledged additional money for the Ministry of Defence, local councils struggling with the cost of social care, primary and secondary schools, and road repairs.But Labours John McDonnell blasted: “We now have it confirmed that the pledge to end austerity was a broken promise, like the whole Budget.“It is now clear austerity is not over, the cuts to social security will continue and Philip Hammond gave no assurances that departments won’t face further cuts.“Eight years of destructive austerity has damaged our economy, damaged people’s incomes and damaged our essential services.Other measures announced in the speech today included the scrapping of the proposed latte levy which would have slapped a tax on all single-use plastic cups.Huge cuts to the maximum stake on crack cocaine gambling machines have been pushed back another six months to protect bookies jobs.Mr Hammond revealed visitors from key countries including the US and Japan will from now on be able to use electronic passport gates at airports - previously restricted to EU citizens.Earlier today, No insisted that the announcements made in the Budget today would apply whether or not Britain strikes a deal with the EU.Theresa Mays spokesman said: We are focused on delivering irrespective of Brexit, starting with todays Budget which locks in the progress we have made.All of the spending commitments that the Chancellor will set out today are funded irrespective of a deal.Mr McDonnell said: What is going on  The PM and the Chancellor contradicting each other. On the day of the Budget. We’ve never seen anything like this.Todays Budget is the first to be held on a Monday for more than half a century.The speech usually takes place on a Wednesday - but this year it was moved to avoid clashing with Halloween, because Mr Hammonds aides wanted to avoid ridicule.

title: italian dad found uk no memory search disappear
story: Detectives have been left baffled by the disappearance of Salvatore Mannino, , who was taken ill in an Edinburgh cathedral and rushed to hospital last month.He had disappeared from his home in Pisa the previous day after dropping his children off at school, and was last seen at a railway station.Mr Mannino was unable to tell police who he was or where he was from, and also claimed not to speak any Italian.According to the Edinburgh Evening News, reports in the Italian media claim the businessman has been charged with violating his family assistance obligations.Chillingly, an Italian news agency reported that investigators had found searches on his laptop of how to disappear without a trace before he turned up in the UK on September .The agency also reports he has been quizzed by the carabinieri, Italys military police.It has also been claimed that Mr Mannino had attempted to close bank accounts of him and his we and move money to ones in her name only.He left a briefcase with €, and a numerical code which was figured out by his teenage son Fillippo.The -year-old told Italian newspaper Corriere della Sera earlier this month: “It was a message Dad left me to decipher, I am sure of it, because he knew I am passionate about mathematical games.”It is also said Mr Mannino checked weather reports for Edinburgh and Aberdeen before going missing.When he was found in Edinburgh he did not have any ID and cops put out an appeal to help identy a “man with no memory”.His we and eldest child flew over but he claimed not to know who they were.He is currently being assessed at a psychiatric ward in Pisa, where doctors are yet to diagnose his condition.Police Scotland say they are not investigating Mr Mannino.

title: passport queues set to get longer as more visitors are allowed to use them
story: The Chancellor said in his Budget today that he would open up e-passport gates at Heathrow and other airports to include people from the US, Canada, New Zealand, Japan and Australia.Philip Hammond said today: Today I can announce a package of measures to stimulate business investment and send a message loud and clear to the rest of the world: Britain is open for business.The move is part of plans to show that Britain is open for business after we leave the EU.But currently the e-passport gates at Britains airports are only available to people in the European Economic Area.Adding five more countries to that list means Brits are likely to have to queue for longer in future.But the Budgets small prints said it would signicantly improve the flow of passengers overall.Tim Alderslade, chief executive of Airlines UK - title: prince harry meghan markle shy schoolboy tummy tickle new zealand
story: Little Joe Young, five, was comforted by parents to be Harry and Meghan when he became overwhelmed outside a cafe in New Zealand.The Duke and Duchess of Sussex had visited Maranui Cafe in title: prince harry meghan markle baby little bump speech
story: The duke, speaking after being formally welcomed by the Manawhenua ki Mohua people, shared his excitement about visiting with a baby on board.He said: From myself and my we and our little bump, we are so grateful to be here.We bring blessings from my grandmother the Queen and our family.We are so grateful for your hospitality and the work you do to look after this beautul place.The duke and duchess were learning about conservation projects at New Zealands smallest national park.The  parents-to-be were welcomed with songs, prayers and hongis - or nose kisses - as they visited the Abel Tasman National Park and spent time at the beachfront on the South Island.Kensington Palace announced that Meghan was expecting a baby next spring on the eve of the marathon -day royal tour, which has seen the couple visit Australia, New Zealand, Fiji and Tonga.Harry and Meghan both had seats of honour for the ceremony, but hers was several inches behind her husband - a sign of protection for women, particularly those who are pregnant, in the initial meeting between iwi, the tribe, and new visitors.Barney Thomas, chief elder, said: We never, ever, put our women in that space.We want to be inclusive but protective, and we would not want to put our women - especially the duchess because shes expecting - at risk.The couple travelled to Abel Tasman by helicopter, with the -minute journey taking the couple over forests, valleys and clear blue waters.They had earlier comforted a nervous boy with Harry giving him a tummy tickle during a visit to a cafe in Wellington.They arrived to drizzle and were escorted to a grass clearing where they were welcomed with the hongi.The couple and their entourage made their way along a line of around  hosts, shaking each by the hand and performing the gentle nose kiss.Mr Thomas gave a speech of welcome in Maori, followed by a waiata, a song, from the group.He said: Weve been watching your tour and we know you dont get much time off. story: Mr Hammonds budget included confirmation of Prime Minister Theresa Mays pledge of #bn extra per year for the NHS by , a #bn boost for defence and #bn more for Universal Credit benefit changes.The chancellors budget book revealed his decisions would mean an extra #bn of spending by -, largely accounted for by the increase in cash for the health service.Buoyant tax receipts and an improved outlook for employment had handed Mr Hammond a "signicant" windfall ahead of his budget, the independent Office for Budget Responsibility revealed.And, as well as the spending plans, Mr Hammond cashed in on the improvement in public finances by bringing forward Conservative manesto tax commitments by a year.Coinciding with the UKs exit from the EU, the personal tax allowance will now rise to #, and the higher rate threshold to #, in April next year -  months earlier than previously planned. title: leicester city fans love vichai for his deeds not his words
story: And then, just as we were getting used to Raksriaksorn, it changed again to something even more unpronounceable. Srivaddhanaprabha - a title bestowed on the -year-old entrepreneur by the Thai royal family, in recognition of his success and philanthropy.Its hard to form a close bond with someone whose name you cant pronounce and have to Google to spell. But we did that at Leicester City Football Club. We loved Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha.We loved Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha not just for who he was - but because of who he wasnt.We loved him not only for what he did - but what he didnt do. The footballing landscape has been ruined by owners who take clubs as playthings, get bored and run them into the ground. You dont need me to tell you who they are. We all know.We knew the dference, at Leicester City Football Club, between good owners and bad ones.Wed lived through the alternative.Wed had owners who didnt care.Wed had owners who couldnt club together the #, needed to buy a former midfield favourite who wanted toto the club. This wasnt the s. It was just over a decade ago.Wed had owners whose grip on the LCFC purse string was so careless it plunged the club into administration.Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha was not like that. When he arrived at Leicester in the summer of , he bought the club from Milan Mandaric. There was concern in some quarters that because Mandaric had sealed the deal then maybe this new Thai chap was cut from the same cloth.He wasnt.If Mandaric was all about hiring and firing and shooting from the hip in pt back page headlines - and, oh boy, he was - then Khun Vichai, to give him his conventional Thai title, was the opposite of that. I was a feature writer at the Leicester Mercury when Vichai arrived. I did all sorts of features about Leicester City during my time there. I never interviewed him. Few people did.He didnt do many interviews. He didnt want to and he didnt have to. So he didnt. He preferred to do what he had to do and stay, unnoticed, in the background.

title: the 2018 budget our experts verdicts
story: THE ECONOMYEd Conway, economics editorAt first glance, this budget was a far bigger deal than many people had been expecting.In fact, look at the simple numbers and this was one of the biggest giveaway budgets ever - though thats almost entirely because of the extra #bn being spent on the NHS.But how did the chancellor find that cash  The short answer is almost entirely through extra borrowing.Earlier this year, the public finances improved dramatically, as more tax receipts started to flood into the Exchequer.But rather than put that money in his pocket, using it to pay off the national debt, the chancellor decided, instead, to spend it. That was a big sht. In hindsight, however, it was hardly surprising.Philip Hammond needed as much money as he could get his hands on to both increase departmental spendingand to fund the giveaways previously announced by the prime minister, most notably the extra NHS spending.And thats before one gets to the rabbit out of his hat: increasing the tax-free personal allowance a year early.Is austerity really coming to an end  It depends how you measure it.If you ignore the NHS, per-capita spending cuts are due to continue in the coming years - albeit gradually.Include the NHS, and it certainly looks like austerity is over.Either way, the pace of cuts has reduced considerably - all at the cost, though, of higher borrowing and public finances that remain very weak.Indeed, the chancellors pledge to eliminate the budget deficit by the middle of the next decade has been well and truly broken, according to the Office for Budget Responsibility.The politics was as interesting as the economics.An end to austerity , abolishing PFI, introducing a tax on tech giants, putting billions into the benefits system and, most of all, the decision to spend rather than save the extra windfall in the public finances.One can hardly imagine previous Conservative chancellors doing that - but that is precisely what this government has done.Its hard to believe it was a Conservative budget. POLITICSBeth Rigby, deputy political editor Phillip Hammond said his was a budget for the "grafters and strivers" who get up early and go to work - as he tried to use his statement to assure them that "their hard work is paying off and the era of austerity is coming to an end".And he put his money where his mouth was, as he brought promised tax cuts for  million people forward by a year.The personal tax allowance is being lted to #, in April , while the level at which the higher rate of tax kicks in will also be raised to #, a year.Those cuts brought him cheers in the chamber, but when it came to wider public spending, it was a jam tomorrow budget for a chancellor boxed in by the economic uncertainty of Brexit. Fiscally, it is dficult to calculate how much the public finances will be affected by Brexit when we still dont knowthe UK will be leaving with a deal or not.There was a bit of extra money for social care , for defence , for schoolsand for potholes and road repairs .In reality, however, the big spending decisions will come next year in a post-Brexit spending review for the whole of Whitehall.But Mr Hammond did find money for Universal Credit to reverse swingeing cuts for Britains lowest earners, promising an extra #bn over the next five years to help ameliorate the worst effects of shting from the old benefits system to the new one.That was well below what some Conservative MPs had been demanding, though.Against the backdrop of Brexit, Mr Hammond was pretty constrained.Ending austerity is a post-Brexit project - and the current incumbents of No  and No  Downing Street may well not be the pair wholl end up delivering it. BUSINESSIan King, business presenterThere were some welcome announcements for business.Entrepreneurs relief, which some had expected to get the chop, lives for another day but the minimum qualying period will be extended from one year to two years to ensure it does genuinely work as intended.Small businesses dodged a bullet when the threshold at which VAT becomes payable was kept at #, for the next two years. Many had expected it to be lowered.There were also tweaks to the use by large private companies of private contractors to avoid paying national insurance. These measures have already been rolled out for the public sector.Then came the much-touted assault on the US tech giants.Digital s "pose a real challenge to the sustainability and fairness of our tax system", said Mr Hammond, highlighting the low taxes paid by the tech multinationals.Pointing out that progress was "painfully slow" in forging an international deal, he announced a new digital services tax, to fall on specically targeted companies. The tax, to be introduced in April , is expected to raise #m a year.

title: why leicester loved vichai srivaddhanaprabha
story: A key component of that incredible victory was the backing of their owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, the Thai billionaire who has died after his helicopter crashed outside the clubs King Power Stadium on Saturday night.His money and support of the team and then manager Claudio Ranieri was a key factor in Leicester achieving a feat which many had previously deemed impossible. After just two seasons in the top ision, they overcame the collective power of established Premier League giants such as Manchester United, Cha and Arsenal to lt the trophy.Long-time season ticket holders who had witnessed Leicesters struggle to avoid relegation just  months earlier delighted in a first title in the clubs -year history.The owners were adopted as local heroes for their part in the most unlikely of triumphs. But it wasnt just the title win that gained Thailands fth-richest billionaire a place in the hearts of Leicester City fans.Mr Srivaddhanaprabha amassed a fortune through the King Power duty free chain, which dominates airports in his native country, but he kept a low profile during his eight years in charge of Leicester City.,targeting:" data-targeting-strnativekey"" data-targeting-"" data-tag"" data-component-name"sdc-site-mpu" aria-label"Advertisement" id"mpu-inline-mobile" data-tolerance""

story: NewsopinionAusterity Britain deserved more than a get well soon card from Philip HammondThe Chancellor wants us to be grateful he is no longer punching us so hardShareCommentsByJason BeattieHead of politics:,  OCT NewsopinionThe country is still in the red despite Tory promises to balance the books "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBeware a Chancellor bearing gts. All Budgets are exercises in sleight of hand. They offer the Government an uninterrupted opportunity to present the economy in the best possible light. So Philip Hammond was not unique in seizing his chance today to paint a picture of a country on the mend. This was, he said, a Budget for Britain’s future - a phrase whose banality was matched only by its duplicity. No Chancellor is going to announce a financial statement which deliberately took the country backwards. Yet history lay heavily on the Budget - the history of previous Tory Governments whose cuts have now come home to roost.  There was extra money for social care, extra money for the universal credit and a “little extra” for school kit. All of this is repairing the damage caused by previous cuts. The poundmillion for social care will not cover the pound.billion being taken from local authorities next year. The pound.billion to help ease the roll out of the universal credit is a fraction of the poundbillion of welfare cuts imposed by George Osborne. The additional poundmillion funding for schools is less than the amount being spent on repairing potholes . Mr Hammond wants us to be grateful he is no longer punching us with same force of the previous Tory bruisers. Many will welcome the increase in the personal allowance yet this is tax cut which does nothing to help those who earn too little to pay income tax and is skewed towards those on higher incomes.

Jeremy Corbyn said the Chancellor had introduced half measures and quick fixes.  And they say the cuts were a political choice. Local councils will see a funding gap of pound. billion by  making it dficult for them to keep already struggling services afloat. While Universal Credit will see some families lose out on pound a month unless the government makes signicant changes. Mr Hammond insisted today that the savage cuts to the public sector since  were not ideologically driven.  Delivering his financial statement, Mr Hammond said it was a budget that paves the way for a brighter future. To loud jeers from the opposite side of the House, he said: The tough decisions of the last eight years were not driven by ideology. They were driven by necessity and by the failure of the party opposite in Government. That was our inheritance and, as ever, we did what was needed to be done. He insisted todays announcement were opening a new chapter in our countrys economic future.  Today I can report to the British people that their hard work is paying off and the era of austerity is finally coming to an end, he said. As part of Mr Hammonds final Budget before the UK leaves the EU in March . And Mr Hammond admitted on Sunday he will have to tear up the whole Budget and write a new onethere is a No Deal Brexit.

story: NewsopinionBudget  sketch: Why Philip Hammond is the worlds worst stand-up comedianIt got really bizarre when Hammond embarked on a y string of one-liners about about toilets during his keynote financial addressShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsopinion "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheres a reason the Chancellor of the Exchequer is known as ‘Spreadsheet Phil’ and not “Hilarious Hammond.” Nevertheless he once again insisted on peppering today’s Budget speech with third rate stand-up comedy. It wasn’t so much a case of “I commend this statement to the house” as “take my Budget…please!” The gag about the speech not being “Hammond’s House of Horrors” was inevitable, given the Tories had moved the Budget back from Wednesday to avoid Halloween. But it got really bizarre when Hammond embarked on a y string of one-liners about about toilets during his keynote financial address.  You see, for some reason the Government is cutting taxes for public loos. “It’s virtually the only announcement in this budget that hasn’t leaked,” the Chancellor wisecracked. “Finally, local authorities can relieve themselves.” It’s a shame, then, that he still refuses to “spend a penny” where it’s really needed. As he sat down, a group of Waspi women started angrily shouting at Phil from the public gallery, furious that he’d spent more time on tax breaks for public conveniences than on sorting out their pensions. And the biggest joke of all was Hammond’s insistence that the era of austerity would soon be over. It certainly got a bigger laugh than his joke about helping schools that can’t afford to pay for pens and books out with more money for the “little extras”. That was a joke, right  RIGHT   Hammond’s hour-long set wasnt the kind of performance that gets you a slot on Live At The Apollo. Youre not likely to see him doing  minutes at the Comedy Store with this kind of material. He doesnt even put on the kind of show you’re likely to see opening for Cannon and Ball on Blackpool Pier. If Phil’s betting his fortune on a future as a comedian once he’s inevitably booted out of Number , he might want to invest a little more in Universal Credit first. He might just need to sign on.

story: NewsBudget : Sneaky Philip Hammond promises more cash for schools - but theres a massive catchTheyll get more money - but theyll only be allowed to spend it on certain thingsShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video mirrors-kevin-maguire-reacts-budget-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPhilip Hammond announced a one off cash boost for schools today, to help with what he called the little extras theyre struggling to buy. Parents may have breathed a sigh of relief at the news, after years of their kids schools sending begging letters home for donations to pay for basics like pens, paper and toilet roll. And the Chancellor certainly made it sound like he would be helping struggling schools with his pound million cash injection. But schools wont actually be able to spend the money on the things they really need. The money has been allocated in the Budget red book as capital spending.  Capital funds are ringfenced for building maintenance and purchasing equipment. That means schools will be allowed to buy iPads with the extra cash, but not pens and paper. And its been noted the money hes set aside for schools is tens of millions less than has been allocated to fix potholes. Geoff Barton, general secretary of the Association of School and College Leaders, said that while the announcement was welcome, schools needed more.  He said: While we welcome any increased investment in schools, the poundm bonus announced today hardly scratches the surface of what is needed. The Chancellors comment that this money will help schools to buy the little extras they need shows a complete misunderstanding of the prevailing funding pressures. Many schools dont have enough money to provide a full curriculum or inidual support to pupils, let alone provide little extras. What they desperately need is improved core funding. He added that it was a sign of the governments priorities that it was spending more on fixing potholes than on fixing the school funding crisis.

story: NewsUniversal Credit handed screeching Budget  U-turn as Tories pile £.bn a year into stricken benefitChancellor Philip Hammond finally handed families up to £ a year extra over warnings of rent debt, food banks and depression - but was blasted for putting a "sticking plaster over a gaping wound"ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video budget--the-key-points-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Tory Budget today unveiled a screeching U-turn over Universal Credit - pouring pound.billion a year more into the stricken benefit. Chancellor Philip Hammond finally acted after furious MPs including his own Tories warned families were being driven to rent debt, food banks and the brink of suicide. In a sensational verdict the Resolution Foundation think tank declared UC is now is more generous the system it replaced. But the move, worth up to pound a year for families, was also blasted as a sticking plaster over a gaping wound - and stops short of the Mirrors demand to halt the cruel rollout of the six-in-one benefit. It came as the top Tory claimed the era of austerity was ending in a Budget that banned PFI deals and launched a new poundm tax on Google and Facebook in Britains final Budget before leaving the EU. Mr Hammond promised poundbn for the Armed Forces and poundbn a year extra for mental health by  while beer, cider, petrol and spirits duties were all frozen - though taxes on cigarettes and wine are going up.  The Chancellor trumped hitting a Tory manesto pledge a year early by raising the Income Tax personal allowance to pound, and p rate - which benefits just % - to pound, from April. Stamp duty will be scrapped for more first time buyers, he said, and the minimum wage is going up to pound. for over-s. But Jeremy Corbyn warned it was a “broken promise budget” with “half-measures and quick fixes while austerity grinds on” - as women denied their pensions protested furiously in the public gallery. Mr Hammond unveiled two separate changes to Universal Credit in todays Budget. He revealed the work allowance - the amount people can earn from work before their benefits start tapering away - will rise by pound, a year from April. Currently it is just over pound,. The Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of Universal Credit and for a review to take place. We say there are three options:Redesign UC to be fit for purpose Axe it in favour of the old systemUC is unfixable Introduce a brand new systemSign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system by signing our petition. The change will mean .million families in low-paid work will get to keep pound of extra income a year, the Treasury claimed. It will cost pound.bn a year by  - poundm in  , poundm in  , pound.bn in  , pound.bn in  , and pound.bn in  . On top of this move there will be poundbillion in transitional cash - spread over five years. It will be worth just poundm in   as almost no one in transitioning to UC straight away. It will then rise to poundm in  , poundm in  , poundm in  , poundm in  , and poundm in  . But critics said it did not go far enough to undo poundbillion a year in Tory cuts that were bundled into the benefit when it first launched. Labour MPs howled in protest during the Budget that the extra transitional fund would make little dference - and it wont apply to million people on Universal Credit by December . PCS union general secretary Mark Serwotka - who represents Universal Credit call handlers - fumed: “Universal Credit has been a disaster for claimants and the cash injection today will do nothing to deal with the inherent structural problems that are blighting thousands of lives.  The Chancellor is trying to put a sticking plaster over a gaping wound. A statement by the Resolution Foundation think tank said: The pound, increase in Work Allowances will deliver a pound boost to low-income families, and means that UC is now more generous than the benefit system it is replacing. However, the Foundation cautions that austerity is not over when it comes to social security. The cash freeze in working age benefits is set to continue next year, saving the Exchequer pound.bn but costing a couple with children in the bottom half of the income distribution pound. Dan Scorer of disability charity Mencap, said: This is not an end to austerity for people with a learning disability and their families. The government has started to listen on the huge problems with Universal Credit, but has done little to address the massive loss of financial support faced by disabled people due to disability premiums being abolished. Emma Revie of foodbank charity the Trussell Trust welcomed the cash - but said it must go further. She said: By failing to ensure benefits cover essential living costs, the Government risks undermining the health, wellbeing and dignity of millions of people. “We know it doesn’t have to be like this. In a country that created a benefits system to anchor people from poverty, it is imperative that the Government goes further.  Campbell Robb, chief executive of the Joseph Rowntree Foundation, said: In the Budget today the Government has taken an important step forward in addressing a burning injustice – the rise of poverty among working families. This move will help make Universal Credit a tool for tackling poverty, and ease the burden for low income families. Labour and the Daily Mirror have demanded Universal Credits rollout is halted and a full review undertaken of the system. Budget documents quietly confirmed, for the first time, that the rollout has been delayed by nine months to finish in December . In apparent proof that the benefit is now costing more than the old system, the Treasury said delaying the rollout will save pound.billion in total by  .  Yet despite this Mr Hammond heaped praise on the system. During his Budget speech, the Chancellor said the old benefits system was broken, and the new system was here to stay. And he praised the “tenacity” of its inventor, former Work and Pensions Secretary Iain Duncan Smith. But he admitted rolling six benefits into one was an “enormous undertaking”. He said he’d already delivered pound.bn in help for people made worse off by being transferred on to the new system including pound.bn at last year’s Budget. Now there will be an extra poundbn package of additional protections over five years - but details will only be confirmed later this year.

title: brit backpacker battered pulp left
story: NewsBrit backpacker battered to a pulp and left for dead in Australia by crowbar-wielding taxi driverWARNING - GRAPHIC IMAGES: Euan Fraser, , says he suffered a bleed on the brain after being brutally beaten unconscious on the doorstep of a Melbourne homeShareCommentsBySophie EvansJack Longstaff:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsEuan Fraser, , is pictured in hospital after the attack in June last year "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA British backpacker claims he was left for dead in Australia after being battered unconscious by a crowbar-wielding cabbie.Euan Fraser, , says the taxi driver beat him to a pulp on the doorstep of a Melbourne home where he was living at the time.After being knocked clean out, he claims he suffered further blows while lying on the floor before being left in a pool of blood. He suffered a bleed on the brain, but fortunately survived.Police are now investigating the circumstances surrounding the assault last year, which left a terried Euan soaked in blood.The young man, from Dundee, Scotland, recalled: As I got out of the taxi I just heard footsteps behind me and heard a loud bang.  Then I felt this immense pain in my head and I was knocked clean out. I was laid into when I was on the floor.I was left laying there in a pool of blood. He left me for dead. I woke up with blood in my eyes and my clothes were soaked. I stumbled into the kitchen and it looked like a murder scene. I had never seen so much blood. My whole body was in agony.I was so scared. He added: I needed  stitches on my face and I had a few broken ribs, a dislocated shoulder and a bleed on the brain. It has totally changed my le forever. Euan, who stands ft ins tall, claims the attack happened following what he thought was a harmless discussion about religion.  Medics reportedly carried out tests which showed he was struck with a thick metal pole, like a crowbar, during the attack. He says he was forced to shell out pound, for his medical treatment and now suffers with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder . I keep reliving what happened in my head, he said. I will never be the same again. Euan who was working on a farm at the time, had flagged down the yellow cab after a night out with a friend in Melbourne in June . He claims the driver became visibly annoyed when he said he was an atheist and when he expressed his views about religion. The architecture student recalled: He didnt like it at all when I started expressing my views... I tried to change the conversation but he kept going on about it. I could see he was getting wound up.  It was after Euan had got out of the car in Aberfeldie, in the early hours of June  that year, that the attack allegedly occurred.He claims that he was expecting the cabbie to drive off when he was suddenly smashed over the head and beaten to a pulp. When he woke up, he recalls having pain all over his body and believes the driver battered him as he laid unresponsive on the pavement. He stumbled into his home before collapsing on the kitchen floor. Euan claims he suffered bruised ribs, a battered shoulder and multiple cuts to his face, as well as the bleed on the brain, in the attack. He called an Uber to Melbournes Sunshine Hospital following the incident, where he stayed for around a week.He says he was forced to borrow money from friends to pay for a pound, medical bill. And he was treated on a specialist mental health ward after he started experiencing suicidal thoughts.  He travelled home to his family a few weeks after the attack. More than a year on, Euan has only just felt able to speak out. He has been reimbursed for his medical bills and awarded pound, in injury compensation by the Australian government. However, cops have yet to trace the taxi driver - and Euan says he is petried to step foot in a taxi, with his confidence shattered.The young man, who lives with his girlfriend, Sharon Macrae, , says he has been left mentally scarred and suffers with PTSD. He said: It has left me in a terrible place and has totally changed my le. I used to be a really confident person but since the attack I have terrible nightmares. It has seriously affected my mental health. Whenever I think about it I get upset. It was just absolutely shocking.  I just cant believe that someone would do that to me. Im a big guy, ft in tall and  stone, and I never thought anyone would be capable of that. Ill be stuck with PTSD for le. I wake up screaming and shouting in the night quite a lot. A Melbourne Police spokesperson said: Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding an assault in Aberfeldie on  June, . It is believed a man was standing outside his home address on Fawkner Street in the early hours of the morning when he was struck in the back of the head by an unknown offender. The victim, -years-old at the time, sustained serious head injuries. The victim reported having a verbal altercation with a taxi driver prior to the incident. Investigators have not identied the offender at this stage and the investigation remains ongoing. Anyone with information has been urged to contact Crime Stoppers on    or submit a confidential report at www.crimestoppersvic.au If you need to speak to someone, Samaritans are available   by calling   or by emailing jo@samaritans.org

title: doctors say new mums should
story: NewsWhy new mums MUST wait a year before getting pregnant again - according to researchNew research has revealed that pregnancies with a gap of just six months were at higher risk of becoming a premature labourShareCommentsByHana Carter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsThe study was conducted on , births by experts at University British Columbia and Hard"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailNew mums who become pregnant less than a year after giving birth could be putting themselves and their unborn baby in danger. The discovery was made by experts at University of British Columbiaand the Hard TH Chan School of Public heath - who studied , births in Canada. According to researchers, parents who waited  to  months after their first child reduced the risk short and long term risks to both mum and baby. Whereas parents who had a little time between pregnancies were at risk of maternal mortality or severe morbidity. The researchers found a short gap between pregnancies affected mothers aged over , while risks to the infant were found for all women - particularly for those aged  to .  Laura Schummers, a post-doctoral fellow at the UBC, said: Our study found increased risks to both mother and infant when pregnancies are closely spaced, including for women older than . The findings for older women are particularly important, as older women tend to more closely space their pregnancies and often do so intentionally. The study is the described by the authors as the most extensive evaluation of how the role of pregnancy spacing could be impacted by maternal age. It is also the first investigation of pregnancy spacing and maternal mortality or severe morbidity - rare but le-threatening complications of pregnancy, labour and delivery - in a high-income country, the authors said.  Among women over  who conceived six months after a previous birth, the researchers found a .% risk of maternal mortality or severe morbidity.Waiting  months between pregnancies, however, reduced the risk to .%, the authors said. For younger women, the researchers found an .% risk of spontaneous preterm birth - delivery before  weeks of pregnancy after labour that started on its own - for pregnancies spaced at six months. For younger women who waited  months between pregnancies, however, the risk dropped to .%. Senior author Dr Wendy Norman, UBC associate professor, said: Achieving that optimal one-year interval should be doable for many women, and is clearly worthwhile to reduce complication risks.

You do get some time to explore and experience the places you are shooting too. It is dferent every day and I love it every day.  She said: The photographers Ive worked with in the past are really good. They message you before with what they needthey need any outfits or anything. The Page  photographer is a woman, who is really good, but I have worked with some guys and there is nothing. Theyre there to do their job and create their images. Despite having a job that revolves around her shape, she denies that she diets. Im not one of those who diets, so the upkeep isnt too bad, it is just making sure my nails are the colour they need on the shoot and washing my hair.  Sometimes you need to take your own clothes or lingerie with you, butits for a big company I get to keep some outfits and they have a stylist and hair and make-up which is always really nice. Brook said thatanyone approached her for advice on how to break into the glamour modelling industry, she would tell them to go for it while at the same time making sure it is what they really want. She said: I would just say to make sure that it is what they want to do, and before anything goes online because once it is there, it is out. If it is what you want to do then just have the confidence to go for it, thats all you need really.

title: group dressed kkk pushed wetherspoons
story: NewsYobs in KKK costumes storm into Wetherspoons pub and pose in street outside Islamic centreThe group were pictured on the street just a few doors down from Bangladesh Islamic Centre in Newtownlands, County Down and also pushed their way into local Wetherspoon pubShareCommentsByElaine McCahill:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsA report of a group dressed as members of the KKK is being treated as a hate crime by police in Northern Ireland "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA gang of yobs dressed in KKK costumes barged into a Wetherspoons pub and were seen outside an Islamic centre. Inspector Richard Murray confirmed police received a report of a group of people dressed as Ku Klux Klan members and the incident was being treated as a hate crime. The group allegedly pushed their way inside a local JD Wetherspoon pub but left when bar staff refused to serve them. Chief Constable George Hamilton told the BBC NIs The Nolan Show: The incident was disgusting and distasteful. Theres no place for it anywhere in Northern Ireland. We will investigate it and report the evidence to the PPS. Footage obtained by BBC News NI shows the men inside the pub, but a spokesman for the chain said the group were refused entry by door staff, but pushed past them into the pub.  Spokesman Eddie Gershon added: They were told by bar staff that they would not be served. They remained in the pub for five minutes, unserved, and then left. An image of the group posing in the street was taken just a few doors down from the Bangladesh Islamic Centre in Newtownards. Belfast Islamic Centre executive treasurer Dr Raied Al-Wazzan urged those involved to come forward. If they keep it quiet for the next  hours, that means it was a deliberate act, he said. If this is just a joke, these people should come forward and identy themselves. To go there specically wearing that costume in front of the Islamic centre is not acceptable. Its similar to somebody wearing a Nazi unorm and going in front of a Jewish synagogue. Strangford MLA Peter Weir said: The appearance in Newtownards on Saturday night of a group of ten or so people dressed from head to foot as members of the KKK, together with a wooden cross is totally unacceptable. The Klu Klux Klan is a deeply repugnant racist organisation and anyone happy to associate themselves with such a vile body is clearly a moron.  That such a large group of people took the time and the effort to get their costumes completely correct, and above all the fact that they chose to pose outside the Islamic Prayer Centre in Newtownards, takes this episode of stupidity to a more sinister connotation. There are very good community relations in Newtownards, with a sense of friendship to all and neighbourliness.All communities are welcome within the town, and everyone should have a right to live free from intimidation and harassment. Local people will completely reject this sort of behaviour and stand against it. The PSNI will be investigating this matter, and I call on anyone with any information to come forward to the Police. Such boorish and malevolent behaviour has no place in our town and it is right that it is condemned across the board. Inspector Murray said: We received a report around pm yesterday, Sunday  October, about a group of people dressed as Ku Klux Klan members in the vicinity of Greenwell Street in the town on Saturday night . We are also aware of images that are circulating that show people dressed as Ku Klux Klan members. Our enquiries are ongoing, and we are treating this as a hate incident at this time. Hate crime, in all its forms, is totally unacceptable. It is the responsibility of each and every one of us to ensure that we live in a society where ersity is respected.

story: NewsMum of student Hannah Cornelius who was raped and murdered was found dead waiting for trial to beginAnna Cornelius, , set up the Hannah Cornelius Foundation to remember her daughterShareCommentsByGrace Witherden:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT News"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe mum of a -year-old student who was raped and murdered in South Africa tragically drowned months before her alleged attackers went on trial. Anna Cornelius died in March this year, less than a year after her daughter Hannah Cornelius was killed. Four men are currently standing trial at Western Cape Court and face charges of rape and murder. In a Facebook post titled When Anna joined Hannah, the Hannah Cornelius Foundation confirmed that Anna died on Sunday, March . Her body was seen floating in shallow water by beachgoers in Scarborough, Cape Town. It said: Anna’s friends and family knew her as an amazing human being, full of light, abundant love and energy. Following her daughter, Hannah’s, death Anna founded the Hannah Cornelius Foundation in June .  It said: Anna was driven to ensure that Hannah’s legacy be remembered through her acts of goodwill, forgiveness and love. Through the Hannah Cornelius Foundation, Anna wished to support other young people to reach beyond the realities of their present circumstances and achieve their dreams through hard work, commitment and a passionate dedication to their own development. Anna was a lawyer and leaves behind her husband, magistrate Willem Cornelius, and son, Dries.  The Hannah Cornelius Foundation aims to help underprivileged children access the opportunities “Hannah had in her le” by offering‚ among other things‚ trauma counselling and help with unplanned pregnancies. Hannah Cornelius was carjacked by four men while dropping off fellow student Cheslin Marsh, , at his home in Stellenbosch, east of Cape Town, after a night out in May . Vernon Witbooi, , Geraldo Parsons, , Nashville Julius, , and Eben Van Nieberk, , face a string of charges including murder, kidnap, robbery and rape of the Stellenbosch University student.  One of the alleged attackers claimed Hannah told the gang they could have sex with herthey let her go afterwards. Parsons said he raped Ms Cornelius first, followed by Witbooi and then van Niekerk. He claims he tried to get them to release Hannah but they put her in the boot and drove her to a vineyard.  The court heard Hannah went through an “extremely painful” ordeal before she was killed. Hannah suffered severe vaginal and cervical injuries in the prolonged attack. The court heard how Parsons had plastic pearls embedded in his penis which would likely have made the sex attack more painful.Heavy bruising on her arms show she had been held down and it is believed that probably several of the gang lted the huge rock and dropped it on her head.  At an earlier hearing, it emerged that Hannahs parents were sent a letter from one of her alleged gang-rapists begging for their forgiveness. Eben van Niekerk penned the letter but claims he was told to write in by Sergeant Steven Adams. The letter was reportedly written after his arrest and before the four men first appeared in court. It was translated from Afrikaans and had a number of errors. The top of the letter says: This letter comes from Eben VNK and it was also signed and initialled.  When translated, the letter reads: Herewith I write this letter to Hennas mom and dad. I am sorry for what I did and I askthey can forgive me for what I have done… The girl was like a friend to me but the other accused, I was also scared of them and it wasnt nice to see. I was also scared of them. Dont be angry at me please .

title: voice star paul black reveals
story: NewsThe Voice star Paul Black reveals how tattoos helped stop him self harming to numb pain of daughter Pearls deathPaul Black, from Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales, lost -month-old Pearl in on August  - after a Range Rover rolled off its driveway into a wall which crushed herShareCommentsByDavid OwensAbigail OLeary:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video pearl-blacks-parents-speak-first-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA star of The Voice who lost his -month-old daughter when she was crushed to death in an accident caused by a rolling car has revealed how he used tattooes to stop himself self-harming to numb the pain. Paul and Gemma Black, from Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales, lost little Pearl on on August ,  - when a Range Rover rolled off its driveway, across a road and demolished a wall which crushed her. The parents have spoken out about the pain they will feel for the rest of their lives, and how not a second in the day passes where they dont grieve for their daughter. Now, Paul, who appeared on the TV talent show in , has undergone extensive tattoos all over his body in a bid to numb the pain - and has even come as close to self harm, reports Wales Online. He described how while using a razor to shave his head, he would dig the blade in to see his own blood. Speaking about his loss and heartbreak, Paul said: Ive used tattooing as my therapy, he said. Its literally been therapy for me because when I sit in that chair, for that amount of time, be it five hours, seven hours, everything goes away. I get into a meditative state. When Im getting tattooed its the only time that everything goes away.  For me I shut my eyes and I dont feel the pain anymore. Its become a huge part of my recovery process. Im nearly done now, Im nearly covered. He did, however, confess that he did start cutting himself but quickly stopped. When my head was shaved I did start to cut myself with a razor. I would stand in a mirror and experience the feeling of the razor going into my head so I could see the blood. I realised quickly that I was spoiling the tattoos. Ive never self-harmed until I shaved my head but I would imagine the tattooing is the closest thing that I would imagine someone who self-harms feels. But as I say it does help me through it. Theres no blood. Its nothing to do with the pain. Its that purely meditative state that I get in when Im being tattooed and I can sit for hours. All the other pain goes away. The former singer said he replays the moment Pearl was hit by the wall over and over in his mind every day. As a result he has been diagnosed with severe Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder . People see me walking down the street and they think I am confident because of this exterior and bravado, but I am absolutely crumbling inside, he said.  I defy any man living to see what Ive seen. No man will see their child getting crushed to death in front of them. No man has seen what Ive seen. He was forced to relive the tragic circumstances leading to his daughters death at the inquest this week and at one point could not bear to say the words out loud. In his heartbreaking evidence he recounted the events leading up to the tragedy and detailed the extraordinary s he went to in a bid to save his two children, Pearl and Ace. He told the court how when the vehicle careered towards him building up speed he threw Ace into the road and tried to step in front of Pearl, but wasn’t quick enough to throw her as well. “The Range Rover proceeded to crush her in front of me, he said. The weight of the wall. She was so small. “I’d rather not go into severe details. There was so much blood. “There was a lot of blood spraying. I could see the death just appearing on her face. “I lted the wall off her. I don’t know how I done it. I was saying: ‘Come back to daddy.’ She was literally limp and leless. “I was screaming: ‘She’s gone, she’s gone, my poor baby girl.’ I was covered in blood.” He told how he was so angry he started to smash up the Range Rover.  “There was a hammer lying on the wall, he said. I smashed every single window. I smashed the back window first. Smashed all the windows, the lights, the bonnet. “I was engulfed with pure anger and rage, as I’m sure you can appreciate. “In my mind, it was the vehicle had killed my little girl. In the  months since that day, Gemma said she still cant bear to visit the scene of where it happened near to her mother-in-laws house. “I havent been to my mother-in-laws house since last August,” said Gemma. “I cant turn left out of the house to go up there.” Paul said the hope that there would be justice for his beautul little girl was one of the things keeping him going. But they said they were devastated when they were told there would be no criminal prosecution against the Range Rovers owner Mr Williams. “We were distraught when the police told us, said Paul.  It was one of the things that was keeping me focused and positive in le - that there would be some sort of justice, some sort of recompense. “Nothing will ever make up for what has happened. No amount of justice would have been right for what has happened to Pearl but it was a huge blow.” The inquest at Pontypridd Coroners Court ruled that Pearls death was an accident. The police investigation had found the car wasnt secure with the handbrake on the empty Range Rover not sufficiently applied. Gemma and Paul are now campaigning for a change to the law, which they say has prevented a charge being brought. “Weve already made grounds to try and get the law changed,” said Gemma. “Weve had a meeting with our local MP Gerald Jones and hes very keen to take it on and to create a private members bill that will be put through Parliament. Were in the process of working through the logistics of this and how we go about this, so thats ongoing.” If you are affected by this story and need to speak to someone, the Samaritans are available   by calling   or by emailing jo@samaritans.org

The horrying video shows how the animal suddenly broke off from performing before it reportedly mauled the helpless child in Russia. One account claimed the lion sank its teeth into the victims head. The young girl, named as Ksenia, is in intensive care with serious face and chest injuries. She survived the incident but doctors say she will be “scarred for le” and a medic says she has been left with a bite mark on her face spanning from her ear to her chin.  The child had been waving a small flag and the lioness rushed from its trainer despite being on a leash and sprang on the child. One account said the wild animal broke a flimsy safety netting around the circus ring at Uspenskoye village in the Krasnodar region. Valentina Pavlova said she was a member of a medical team which treated the girl at the Central Republican Hospital in Krasnodar. “There is a bite on her face that goes from ear to chin,” she said.  She added that the lioness used its paw and pulled the child inside onto the arena and sank its teeth into her head. “The circus team pulled the lioness away and delivered the girl to the Central Republican Hospital. “She is now in stable condition, there is no danger to her le.”  The child is being treated in intensive care. Wild animals continue to be used for performances in Russian circuses, including many touring troupes that go from place to place. The latest incident is likely to lead to increase calls to ban the use of performing predators like lions and bears.

title: muslim woman 21 lashed public
story: NewsMuslim woman, , lashed in public under Sharia law for getting too close to her boyfriendThe -year-old was sentenced to a brutal lashing in front of crowds of bystandersShareCommentsByMirror:,  OCT NewsA young woman bows her head and kneels as she awaits being caned for getting too close to her boyfriend "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA young woman and her boyfriend were whipped in public in Indonesia after being caught in close proximity to each other under draconian Sharia law. The -year-old was forced to kneel on a makesht stage with her head bowed before being caned with bamboo by a masked enforcer. She was then hauled off the  by two female police officers while her partner was also whipped as punishment for standing too close to each other in public. The public punishment took place in the city of Banda Aceh - where Sharia law is strictly practised and enforced.  The crime of being in close proximity to someone of the opposite sex can be punished by up to  lashes. Other offences such as gay sex, adultery, drinking alcohol and gambling can result in up to  lashes. Aceh is the only province in the country to impose Islamic criminal law and was granted increasingly special powers in  when the government struck a deal with separatists.  Indonesia is one of the most largely populated Muslm countries in the world with more than  per cent of the  million inhabitants practising the faith. Earlier this year a bride-to-be and her fiance were also publicly thrashed in the same city, after being found guilty of getting too close. Closeness is seen as a step towards pre-martial sex which is against Sharia Law and as a result the couple each received  lashes, in front of gathering crowds.  The punishments take place outside a mosque and draw huge crowds, many of whom take pictures. Meanwhile, in Malaysia, two women aged  and  were caned for having lesbian sex in a car. The women were sentenced to six lashings each and a fine of pound despite a global outcry from activists who say the sentence has no place in any civilised society.
